newsitem.title: GERMANY: Ivorians may have sold 550,000 T 97/98 cocoa - A&D.
newsitem.headline: Ivorians may have sold 550,000 T 97/98 cocoa - A&D.

text.p: German cocoa trader Albrecht & Dill GmbH said on Friday the Ivory Coast could have sold 550,000 tonnes from its upcoming 1997/98 cocoa main crop (October/September).
The trader's weekly report cited information received from shippers and added this would be a higher figure than so far expected.
Some of A&D's sources even estimated sales in excess of 600,000 tonnes, the report said.
A year ago, Ivorian forward sales from the anticipated 1996/97 crop totalled 500,000 tonnes.
A&D put Ivorian sales from the current 1996/97 crop to date at 940,000 tonnes.
A year ago at this stage, 1,060,000 tonnes from the 1995/96 crop had been sold for export.
